content.user_title: Implement ISO 27001 ISMS for Healthcare Organizations
content.value_statement: Healthcare and medical device organizations face complex information security compliance requirements. This skill provides expert guidance on ISO 27001 Information Security Management System implementation, cybersecurity risk assessment, and security controls management for HealthTech environments.
actual_capabilities: Design and implement ISO 27001 ISMS frameworks aligned with 2022 standards
Conduct systematic information security risk assessments using established methodologies
Implement ISO 27002 security controls across organizational, people, physical, and technological domains
Develop comprehensive information security policies and governance frameworks
Prepare organizations for ISO 27001 certification audits and compliance verification
Integrate healthcare-specific security requirements including HIPAA and FDA cybersecurity guidance
limitations: This skill provides guidance and documentation templates only; it does not execute security controls or make system changes
Skill does not perform live vulnerability scanning, penetration testing, or technical security assessments
Consultation is advisory; final implementation decisions remain with the organization and security team

use_cases.title: Build ISMS Foundation
use_cases.description: Establish comprehensive ISO 27001 ISMS structure with policies, risk assessments, and controls mapped to healthcare regulatory requirements

use_cases.title: Prepare Certification Audit
use_cases.description: Conduct gap assessments, develop audit checklists, and implement remediation plans for ISO 27001 certification readiness

use_cases.title: Implement Device Security
use_cases.description: Apply FDA cybersecurity guidance and IEC 62304 requirements to connected medical device security architecture and controls

prompt_templates.title: ISMS Kickoff
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me design an Information Security Management System for a mid-size medical device company. Include the key phases for ISO 27001:2022 certification, critical policies needed, and how to structure the risk assessment methodology for healthcare data.

prompt_templates.title: Risk Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a comprehensive information security risk assessment framework for our healthcare organization. Include asset classification approach, threat identification methodology, risk evaluation criteria, and risk treatment options for clinical data and medical device systems.

prompt_templates.title: Controls Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me map our current security controls to ISO 27002:2022 requirements. Focus on organizational controls, technological controls for healthcare systems, and how to address the shared responsibility model for our cloud service providers.

prompt_templates.title: Audit Preparation
prompt_templates.prompt: Develop an internal audit program for ISO 27001 compliance. Include audit checklist templates for management review, security incident procedures, continuous improvement processes, and evidence collection requirements for Stage 1 and Stage 2 certification audits.

output_examples.input: Help me understand the key differences between ISO 27001:2013 and 2022 versions for our certification update
output: ISO 27001:2022 introduces 11 new control clauses reducing the total from 114 to 93 controls
New control themes include cloud services, data privacy, information security for cloud and ICT services, and threat intelligence
Risk assessment requirements now explicitly reference ISO 27005 for methodology guidance
Documented information requirements streamlined with clearer mapping between clauses
Governance and supply chain controls significantly expanded reflecting modern threat landscape

output_examples.input: What security controls do we need for our cloud-based patient data management system under HIPAA
output: Access Control: Implement role-based access with MFA for all PHI access points
Audit Controls: Enable comprehensive logging with 6-year retention for audit trails
Integrity Controls: Hash verification and digital signatures for data at rest and in transit
Transmission Security: TLS 1.3 for all data transmission with certificate validation
Encryption: AES-256 for PHI at rest with separate key management infrastructure
Backup and Recovery: Encrypted daily backups with tested quarterly restore procedures

best_practices: Engage senior leadership early to establish clear security objectives and allocate resources for ISMS implementation
Map regulatory requirements (HIPAA, GDPR, FDA) to ISO 27001 controls to avoid redundant compliance efforts
Conduct tabletop exercises for incident response before actual security incidents occur
anti_patterns: Implementing ISO 27001 controls without first defining risk criteria and acceptance thresholds
Treating ISO 27001 certification as a one-time project rather than a continuous improvement cycle
Copying policies from other organizations without adapting to your specific context and risk profile

faq.question: How long does ISO 27001 certification typically take?
faq.answer: Timeline ranges from 6 to 18 months depending on organization size, existing controls, and available resources for implementation.

faq.question: Is this skill suitable for small healthcare startups?
faq.answer: Yes, the guidance scales from foundational ISMS elements for startups to comprehensive frameworks for larger healthcare enterprises.

faq.question: Does the skill provide implementation tools?
faq.answer: The skill offers frameworks, templates, and guidance. Python scripts for metrics and risk assessment are referenced but must be used according to their documentation.

faq.question: How does this skill integrate with HIPAA compliance?
faq.answer: ISO 27001 controls map directly to HIPAA Security Rule requirements. The skill provides cross-reference guidance for healthcare-specific implementations.

faq.question: Can this skill help with GDPR data protection requirements?
faq.answer: Yes, the privacy-security integration guidance addresses technical measures supporting data subject rights and cross-border data transfer security.

faq.question: What makes healthcare ISO 27001 implementation different?
faq.answer: Healthcare requires additional controls for clinical data protection, medical device cybersecurity, FDA guidance compliance, and clinical trial data handling.
